metadata.title: httpd: Security issues viaÂ backend applications whose response headers are malicious or exploitable (important)
metadata.description:
DOCUMENTATION: A flaw was found in httpd. Backend applications whose response headers are malicious or exploitable may allow information disclosure, server-side request forgery (SSRF) or local script execution. 
            STATEMENT: This flaw can only be exploited by backend applications via malicious or exploitable response headers.

Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6 is not affected by this vulnerability because the vulnerable code was introduced in a newer version of httpd.
            MITIGATION: Red Hat has investigated whether a possible mitigation exists for this issue, and has not been able to identify a practical example. Please update the affected package as soon as possible.

criterions.comment: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9 is installed
jbcs-httpd24-httpd is signed with Red Hat redhatrelease2 key
Red Hat Enterprise Linux must be installed
